definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: A hotdog when she came for lunch, Chinese if she stayed for dinner.
sentences.chinese: 午餐喫熱狗，如果能呆到晚餐時間那就喫中餐。

sentences.english: The next morning, I decided to cook eggs and hotdogs for our breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早上我決定做雞蛋和熱狗早餐。

sentences.english: Bullet: A woman in California swears that she quite literally “bit the bullet” while eating a hot dog.
sentences.chinese: 加州的一名女士稱，自己在喫熱狗食“咬到了子彈”。

sentences.english: Hondo :How can I trust a man who won't eat a good old-fashioned American hotdog?
sentences.chinese: 我怎麼能信任一個不願喫老式美國熱狗的人？

sentences.english: They don't want to be hot-dog.
sentences.chinese: 因爲它們不想成爲熱狗。

sentences.english: Should we have testing at Nathan’s hot dog places?
sentences.chinese: 我們要在內森熱狗店設檢測點麼？

sentences.english: Answer:They don't want to be hot-dog.
Maybe I’ll be tempted by the hot sizzle of hot dogs being sold around the corner.
sentences.chinese: 也許我會被那個角落烤熱狗發出的嘶嘶聲引誘過去。

sentences.english: “Same as a street hot dog?” she asked.
sentences.chinese: “和路邊賣的熱狗用的洋蔥一樣？”她問道。

sentences.english: Hot dog is hot dog lah.
sentences.chinese: 他告訴記者，“熱狗就是熱狗。

sentences.english: Hot dog is hot dog lah.
sentences.chinese: 他告訴記者，“熱狗就是熱狗。

sentences.english: He wanted to nickel me up for another hot dog.
sentences.chinese: 他想花5分錢讓我再給他一個“熱狗”喫。

sentences.english: Please buy some hotdog and hamburger buns for our barbecue.
sentences.chinese: 請買一些烤肉時要喫的熱狗和做漢堡用的圓麪包。

sentences.english: That’s two hamburgers, a hot dog and three colas.
sentences.chinese: 兩個汗堡，一個熱狗三個可樂。

sentences.english: Finally, the dogs are packaged, loaded on delivery trucks, and sent off to food markets.
sentences.chinese: 最後，把熱狗包裝好，裝上運貨車，然後送到食品場。

sentences.english: They don't want to be hot-dogs.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他們不想成爲熱狗。

definition: to cook on a skewer/barbecued food on a skewer/shish kebab/(fig.) to perform or play songs in sequence/sequence of songs/medley
brand of Hong Kong instant noodles/also used as term for instant noodles in general
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
rice noodle roll, a roll made from sheets of rice flour dough, steamed and stuffed with meat, vegetables etc
(at a restaurant) to order a meal/(of a waiter) to take an order
